content: The Act titled "Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Act of 1999" allows the Court to prescribe rules and regulations under Section 7254 of title 38, United States Code. Additionally, the Act includes provisions for the recall of retired judges. The "Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Act of 1999" allows for the recall of retired judges of the Court of Veterans Appeals for further service in accordance with specific requirements. The "Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Act of 1999" allows for the recall of retired judges for further service on the court, with specific limitations on the duration of recall periods. The "Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Act of 1999" allows for the recall of retired judges for further service on the court. If a recall-eligible retired judge declines to perform service, they will be removed from the status of a recall-eligible judge. A disabled recall-eligible retired judge unable to perform further service will also be removed. Retired judges recalled under this section may exercise all powers and duties of a judge in active service. Retired judges recalled under the "Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Act of 1999" may exercise all powers and duties of a judge in active service. The pay for recalled judges who retired under chapter 83 or 84 of title 5 is specified, and they are considered reemployed annuitants under that chapter. This section does not affect the right of retired judges to serve as reemployed. Retired judges under chapter 83 or 84 of title 5 can serve as reemployed annuitants. A new item is added to the table of sections in the chapter. SEC. 4. Calculation of years of service as a judge is amended to credit only years of service as a judge of the Court for retirement purposes. Fractional years are disregarded if less than 183 days and credited as a full year if 183 days or more. SEC. 5. Judges' retired pay. Section 7296 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to specify the retired pay for judges. For recall-eligible retired judges, the pay is based on the pay of a judge of the court. For judges who did not provide notice of availability for service in a recalled status, the retired pay is based on the rate applicable to that judge. The retired pay for judges under Section 7296 of title 38, United States Code, is based on the pay of a judge at the time of retirement. Cost-of-living adjustments apply only to retired pay computed under specific subsections. Cost-of-living adjustments for retired judges are limited to ensure their pay does not exceed the annual rate of pay for active judges as specified in the relevant sections of the United States Code. Cost-of-living adjustments for retired judges are limited to prevent their pay from exceeding the annual rate of pay for active judges. If a retired or reserve member of a uniformed service becomes a judge of the court, their retired or retainer pay will not be paid during active service on the court but will resume or commence without reduction upon retirement as a judge. Retired judges practicing law for clients on veterans' benefits will lose their retired pay for a year. SEC. 7. EARLY RETIREMENT AUTHORITY FOR CURRENT JUDGES IN ORDER TO PROVIDE FOR STAGGERED TERMS OF JUDGES. Retirement Authorized for eligible judges of the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims with specific service requirements and age criteria from 1999 to 2003. If multiple judges qualify, the one with the most seniority will be selected. The judge eligible to retire in a specific year from the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims must provide written notice to retire by April 1, except for 1999 where the deadline is November 1 or 15 days after the enactment of the Act. The retirement notice is irrevocable and must specify the retirement date. A judge eligible to retire from the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims must provide written notice by a specific deadline. The retirement date must be at least 90 days after the notice is provided. Retired judges are considered under a specific section of the United States Code and receive retired pay based on a certain rate. Section 7296 of title 38, United States Code, outlines the formula for calculating retired pay for judges of the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims. The formula takes into account the years of service and age of the judge, with adjustments in retired pay available for recall-eligible retired judges. The formula for calculating retired pay for judges of the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims includes adjustments for recall-eligible retired judges.
